subsection.name: Operating Systems
subsection.p:
The Hippo ECM software is able to run on at least the following Operating Systems:
Windows XP/2000, Windows Server 2003
Linux, RedHat (RHEL), SUSE (SLES), Debian, Ubuntu and other distributions
FreeBSD and other BSD variants
Solaris 9/10 and OpenSolaris
IBM AIX
It should be possible to run the software on any POSIX compliant Operating System.

subsection.name: Java versions
subsection.p:
To run Hippo ECM Java 1.4, Java 5 or Java 6 is required. The following JVMs can be used:
Sun JVM
IBM JVM
BEA JRockit

subsection.name: Application Containers
subsection.p:
Hippo ECM requires an application container. One of the following can be used:
Jetty 6
Tomcat 5.5 and 6
IBM WebSphere Application Server 6
BEA WebLogic Server 10
JBoss Application Server 4
Sun ONE Application Server and Sun Glassfish V2

subsection.name: Databases
subsection.p:
Hippo ECM requires a relational database for it's datastorage. By default Apache Derby is embedded and configured and runs "out of the box". It is however possible to configure other databases such as:
MySQL 4.1, 5.0 and 5.1
PosgreSQL 8
Oracle 9 and 10
MS SQLServer
Derby
